channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Hmmm. I suspect a lot of folks in the Army had access to classified materials — and strong training in their proper handling. Interesting that there are lots of ex-military Democrats holding seats in purple congressional districts. https://t.co/qupSLAfKEH
item.source:markdown: Hmmm. I suspect a lot of folks in the Army had access to classified materials — and strong training in their proper handling. Interesting that there are lots of ex-military Democrats holding seats in purple congressional districts. https://t.co/qupSLAfKEH

item.description: @AvBronstein @MisfitTorah Obviously, YU’s board of directors does not have a great track record with even medium term forecasting, but personally I wouldn’t trade northern Manhattan real estate for Florida. https://t.co/upQc56BKRw

item.description:

item.description: @trekonomics @HeerJeet Oooh. I can imagine that be outed as dating a neoliberal could be problematic in some circles.

item.description: @DrZackaryBerger @PesteMagazine I first took this to be @PasteMagazine and was very confused.

item.description: @IrMiklat No, thank you for writing it!
item.source:markdown: @IrMiklat No, thank you for writing it!

item.description: @DavidAstinWalsh It is totally possible that TFG received information to that effect in a classified PDB and had no idea that that bit of info was public knowledge.
item.source:markdown: @DavidAstinWalsh It is totally possible that TFG received information to that effect in a classified PDB and had no idea that *that* bit of info was public knowledge.

item.description:
I confess: I did not have “Lakewood cuts down trees in act of sodomy” on my 2022 chilul Hashem bingo card. https://t.co/9V0lIrqbJa

Now, I don’t know how much direct influence the Lakewood yeshiva community has on the town council. But clearly, Jewish values concerning both the poor and trees failed to manifest beyond the walls of the yeshiva — if they are even present there.

Meanwhile, if you want proper Talmudic wisdom on the situation, I again recommend Justice in the City by @IrMiklat https://t.co/VkqWjP2oYX

I am informed from a frum source closer to Lakewood than I am that “This was an internal decision with some input from some local businesses, primarily Hispanic. I haven't heard from anyone yet here that was supportive of this move.”
item.source:markdown:
I confess: I did not have “Lakewood cuts down trees in act of sodomy” on my 2022 chilul Hashem bingo card. https://t.co/9V0lIrqbJa
Now, I don’t know how much direct influence the Lakewood yeshiva community has on the town council. But clearly, Jewish values concerning both the poor and trees failed to manifest beyond the walls of the yeshiva — if they are even present there.
Meanwhile, if you want proper Talmudic wisdom on the situation, I again recommend Justice in the City by @IrMiklat https://t.co/VkqWjP2oYX
I am informed from a frum source closer to Lakewood than I am that “This was an internal decision with some input from some local businesses, primarily Hispanic. I haven't heard from anyone yet here that was supportive of this move.”

item.description: @WinterlightHome Yes. There is lots wrong with the Jewish community, and you’ve accurately named one piece of it.
item.source:markdown: @WinterlightHome Yes. There is lots wrong with the Jewish community, and you’ve accurately named one piece of it.

item.description: @Ah_Pook_Is_Here @YourVote2022 @TristanSnell Right. It’s not his call whether to indict — but it would be irresponsible at this point for Garland not to give him (and the FBI) a heads-up.
item.source:markdown: @Ah_Pook_Is_Here @YourVote2022 @TristanSnell Right. It’s not his call whether to indict — but it would be irresponsible at this point for Garland not to give him (and the FBI) a heads-up.

item.description:
@WinterlightHome I hear it.

@WinterlightHome The parts of shul-going I like the best involve the individual — davening, leyning, Torah study, social justice work.

item.description: @6502_ftw People want to believe. That’s what makes shamelessness such a superpower.

item.description:
@WinterlightHome Books! Texts! Poems!

@WinterlightHome So much much of that family focus comes down to people seeing Judaism as kid stuff that only matters for the next generation of kids.

@WinterlightHome It creates synagogues that serve the bar mitzvah, rather than b mitzvahs that serve the synagogue.

item.description:
@trekonomics It’s a classic. By which I mean it was genuinely mind blowing two generations ago.

@trekonomics I ploughed through it the summer I turned 13. I wasn’t that impressed; perhaps it was over my head.

@trekonomics But I doubt it was worse than Ivanhoe, which my English teacher tried to convince me has merit a couple years later.
Remember the Benghazi hearings. Never retreat. Never surrender. https://t.co/hOeju0MAHd
